name: Allister
brief: One of the four starting survivors from Kingdom Death: Monster, reimagined as a 10th Anniversary figure showing the ingenuity and grit required to endure the darkness.

name: Zachary
brief: One of the four starting survivors from Kingdom Death: Monster, reimagined as a 10th Anniversary figure showing the ingenuity and grit required to endure the darkness.

name: Lucy
brief: One of the four starting survivors from Kingdom Death: Monster, reimagined as a 10th Anniversary figure showing the ingenuity and grit required to endure the darkness.

name: Erza
brief: One of the four starting survivors from Kingdom Death: Monster, reimagined as a 10th Anniversary figure showing the ingenuity and grit required to endure the darkness.

name: Seed Patterns
brief: A spark of crafting inspiration that accompanies insight gleaned about the world. When survivors reach their insights, they draw a Pattern that describes what to use and how to craft brand new gear.

name: Twilight Knights
brief: Warriors who stand on the edge of the known world, their lives devoted to battling foul creatures and horrifying abominations to shield the weak from such peril.

name: Hooded Knight
brief: A story event in Kingdom Death: Monster that receives an upgrade through the Allison expansion.

name: Tattered Parcel
brief: A story event sticker that can be affixed to the Kingdom Death: Monster core rulebook to upgrade the Hooded Knight story event.

name: Dormant Twilight Cloak
brief: A rare gear card accessible through the Tattered Parcel story event upgrade.

name: Blue Lantern
brief: A rare gear card accessible through the Tattered Parcel story event upgrade.

name: Ashbloom
brief: A character known for unflagging optimism that causes Gnostin to pray for death. Featured as a collectible bust with dynamic details from the original sculpt.

name: Gnostin
brief: A character who prays for death due to Ashbloom's unflagging optimism.

name: Aya the Survivor
brief: A survivor whose exploits are followed in a series of sculptures. She is on a journey and hunt, armed with powerful weapons that suggest she is pursuing a dangerous quarry.

name: Black Sword
brief: A deadly weapon wielded by Aya the Survivor at the start of her journey.

name: Beacon Shield
brief: A weapon carried by Aya the Survivor alongside her Black Sword at the beginning of her hunt.

name: Vagabond Armor
brief: An armor set worn by Aya that provides unique bonuses, included as a game card in the expansion.

name: Tabard
brief: A gear item that is part of the Vagabond Armor set, included as a game card.

name: White Dragon Gauntlets
brief: Gauntlets that are part of the Vagabond Armor set, included as a gear card for gameplay use.

name: Black Friday Formal Erza
brief: A character presented in formal black tie attire for Black Friday, described as arriving in bold style for the darkest day of the year. Available as a painters scale photoresin miniature.

name: Black Knight Order
brief: A once-great organization with secretive artifices and squires. The order has a citadel where squires serve under the auspices of the restless guardian.

name: Black Knight's Citadel
brief: The claustrophobic remains of the Black Knight's domain where chaotic, ruinous battles take place. It is located on an inverted mountain with dangerous edges.

name: Cliffside Sanctuary
brief: The location where the feral guardian Black Knight awaits, summoned by the tolling of a strange bell.

name: Inverted Mountain
brief: A dangerous mountainous location with treacherous edges where survivors can careen off during battle with the Black Knight.

name: Cain
brief: One of four dutybound squires whose fate can be learned through the Squires of the Citadel campaign.

name: Iola
brief: One of four dutybound squires whose fate can be learned through the Squires of the Citadel campaign.

name: Elle
brief: One of four dutybound squires whose fate can be learned through the Squires of the Citadel campaign.

name: Owen
brief: One of four dutybound squires whose fate can be learned through the Squires of the Citadel campaign.

name: Squires of the Citadel Campaign
brief: A 5 lantern year campaign exploring the secretive life of squires in the Black Knight's citadel. It tells the tale of four dutybound squires using ready-to-play gear grids and survivor vignette cards.

name: Dragon King
brief: A node 3 quarry monster whose species is long dead, remaining alone and clinging to memories of its once mighty race. It stalks the darkness with wildly swinging moods from impotent rage to obsessive nostalgia, emanating ruinous pain from its glowing heart.

name: Phoenix
brief: A monster that the Dragon King expansion replaces in Kingdom Death: Monster campaigns.

name: People of the Stars
brief: A brand new 25 lantern year campaign included in the Dragon King expansion that tells the story of a settlement raised by the Tyrant. It includes unique stories, advantages, and challenges leading up to final judgement.

name: Tyrant
brief: An ancient being that molds survivors in the image of its lost civilization, raising settlements in the People of the Stars campaign.

name: Flower Knight
brief: An enigmatic knight known for its ethereal beauty and unmatchable swordplay. This node 2 quarry monster rewards luck and punishes survivors who try to gang up on it, with rewards that explore themes of addiction and short-term gain coupled with long-term losses.

name: Screaming Antelope
brief: A quarry monster that can be replaced by the Flower Knight in Kingdom Death: Monster campaigns.

name: Fairy Ring
brief: A terrain feature associated with the Flower Knight expansion, represented by 4 sections included in the expansion.

name: Bullfrogdog
brief: A variant of the Frogdog lurking at the farthest edges of the darkness, representing a new threat that emerges as campaigns progress beyond the mightiest Frogdogs.

name: Tusked Horror
brief: A tusked variant of the Bullfrogdog described as a powerfully toothy beast that provides a completely different showdown experience with new AI, HL, and resource cards.

name: Tuskworks
brief: A settlement location mentioned in the contents, likely related to the Bullfrogdog and tusked variants.

name: Gambler's Chest
brief: An expansion that allows players to hunt new monsters, grow deviant survivors, and change the rules of Kingdom Death: Monster.

name: Atnas the Child-Eater
brief: A named monster included in the Gambler's Chest expansion.

name: The Gambler
brief: A character included in the Gambler's Chest expansion.

name: Godhand
brief: A character included in the Gambler's Chest expansion.

name: Crimson Crocodile
brief: A monster in the expansion that comes with associated armor set miniatures.

name: Smog Singers
brief: A monster in the expansion that comes with associated armor set miniatures.

name: Bone Eaters
brief: Encounter Monsters that increase the danger of the hunt.

name: The King
brief: A character included in the Gambler's Chest expansion.

name: White Fang
brief: A character miniature included in the expansion.

name: Last Axeman Standing
brief: A character miniature included in the expansion.

name: Scouts of Death
brief: Male and female scout models that add new difficulty to the game.

name: Murderer
brief: A character miniature included in the expansion.

name: Bowmaster of Deadrock
brief: A character from the location Deadrock included in the expansion.

name: Bloody Sword of Deadrock
brief: A character from the location Deadrock included in the expansion.

name: Deadrock
brief: A location referenced in character names, associated with the Bowmaster and Bloody Sword characters.

name: Dark Eye
brief: A character miniature included in the expansion.

name: Romantic Adventurer
brief: A character miniature included in the expansion.

name: Screaming Hoarder
brief: A character miniature included in the expansion.

name: Cockroach Queen
brief: A character miniature included in the expansion.

name: Nightmare Adam
brief: A character miniature included in the expansion.

name: Anna, Gourmet Hunter
brief: A named character who is described as a gourmet hunter.

name: Sci-Fi Aya
brief: A character miniature with a science fiction theme included in the expansion.

name: Neko Twilight Knight
brief: A character miniature that appears to be a cat-themed version of a Twilight Knight.

name: Wanderers
brief: Visitors that come to your settlement whose stories intertwine with the survivors' stories.

name: Encounter Monsters
brief: A type of monster that increases the danger of hunts.

name: Aya
brief: A survivor whose exploits are chronicled in a series of sculptures. Before the Wall represents the start of her journey, armed with deadly weapons suggesting a powerful quarry awaits at the end of her hunt.

name: The Hand
brief: A nemesis monster from the core game campaign that the Black Knight replaces at node 3.

name: Citadel
brief: The Black Knight's domain, a cliffside sanctuary atop an inverted mountain where survivors face the nemesis in its claustrophobic remains.

name: Strange Bell
brief: A mysterious bell whose tolling compels the settlement to feel an inescapable call to face the Black Knight.

name: Bullfrogdog Tusked Horror
brief: A variant of the Frogdog lurking at the farthest edges of the darkness. A powerfully toothy beast that emerges as a new threat when campaigns surpass the mightiest Frogdogs, featuring completely different AI, HL, and resource cards.

name: Scout Discovery and Tablet
brief: A new gameplay element included with the Frogdog expansion, likely related to the special hunt event where survivors probe murky waters for strange resources.

name: Scouts
brief: A new system that adds difficulty to the game.

name: Philosophy System
brief: A variant strain system allowing survivors new ways to grow and power to chase.

name: Shadowstalker
brief: A named survivor character included as a miniature in the Gambler's Chest.

name: Champion of the Goblin
brief: A named survivor character included as a miniature in the Gambler's Chest.

name: Romantic Leyline Walker
brief: A named survivor character included as a miniature in the Gambler's Chest.

name: Squires of the Citadel
brief: A 5 lantern year campaign exploring the secretive life of squires who scurry in the shadows of the citadel, serving under the restless guardian.

name: Constellation
brief: A game system unique to the Dragon King expansion, represented by 8 constellation cards that appear to be part of the People of the Stars campaign mechanics.

name: Crimson Crocodile Armor
brief: An armor set crafted from Crimson Crocodile resources. Includes 4 miniatures.

name: Smog Singer Armor
brief: An armor set crafted from Smog Singer resources. Includes 4 miniatures.

name: Death King Armor
brief: An armor set associated with The King monster. Includes 4 miniatures.

name: Beast Hunter Armor
brief: An armor set included in the Gambler's Chest expansion.

name: Sprinter Armor
brief: An armor set included in the Gambler's Chest expansion.

name: Imitation Butcher Armor
brief: An armor set that imitates the Butcher nemesis monster's appearance.

name: Axerman Family
brief: A family group of survivors (3 models) including the Last Axeman Standing character.

name: Scout System
brief: A gameplay system that adds new difficulty through Scout characters.

name: Seed Pattern System
brief: A system providing new ways to craft gear using Seed Patterns.

name: Encounter System
brief: A system that increases the danger of the hunt with Encounter Monsters.

name: Wanderer System
brief: A system where visitors come to your settlement, their stories intertwining with the survivors'.

name: Character System
brief: A system to create new Characters with enduring appeal across campaigns.

name: Gorm
brief: A node 1 quarry monster that travels enormous distances in its life cycle, shaping landscapes with its enormous appetite and extreme bodily functions. Young Gorm roam the darkness devouring anything that moves, older Gorm produce storms of incredible destruction during mating season, and ancient Gorm make a final solitary march to the gormyards to die.

name: Gormyards
brief: Fabled locations where ancient Gorm that have lived hundreds of lantern years make their final solitary march to die.

name: Regeneration Suit
brief: Survivor gear included in the Gorm expansion sprues, represented as a Pinup miniature variant.

name: Ritika
brief: An Indomitable Survivor known as the Poison Partisan. She battles a spider-like monster and its swarming brood, ultimately toppling the creature and extracting a florid organ from its corpse after smashing the spiderlings.

name: Spidicules
brief: A spider-like monster with multiple legs, spindly fingers, and a body that emanates a greasy miasma. It spawns legions of spiderlings that swarm at its phenomenal call and will voraciously devour even their progenitor's corpse.

name: Aggregate Silk Gland
brief: An indomitable resource obtained from Spidicules. Likely the 'florid organ' with an oily stench extracted from the monster's corpse.

name: Poison Partisan
brief: A gear pattern associated with Ritika, consisting of a pattern card and pattern gear card included with the miniature.

name: Indomitable Survivor
brief: A category of special named survivors in Kingdom Death who have triumphed over specific monsters and come with unique resources and gear patterns.

name: Kale
brief: An indomitable survivor who, in a final act of defiance against a roaring White Lion, threw himself headlong at the beast's howling maw and slew it with his blade.

name: Roaring Harmonica
brief: A piece of gear associated with Kale's victory over the White Lion, available as both a craftable pattern and finished gear card.

name: Layered Maxilla
brief: An indomitable resource obtained from a White Lion, used in crafting special gear.

name: Tachyon Nodachi
brief: A weapon with apparent time-manipulation properties, crafted as gear with an associated pattern card for creation.

name: Neutron Seed
brief: A Phoenix resource that blinks in and out of existence, plucked from the monster's shimmering entrails. Classified as an indomitable resource.

name: Tyrant Slayer Scarlet
brief: An indomitable survivor who battles a great monster, gripping its reticulated horns as they rocket into darkness. She falls toward boiling ground with her weapon outstretched in vain hope after her companion's arrow fells the beast.

name: Serpentine Tailbone
brief: An indomitable resource derived from the Dragon King, included with indomitable survivor miniature sets.

name: Tyrant Slayer
brief: A gear pattern associated with the indomitable survivor Scarlet, consisting of a pattern card and pattern gear card.

name: Seed Pattern
brief: A spark of crafting inspiration that accompanies insight gleaned about the world. When survivors reach their insights, they draw a Pattern which describes what to use and how to craft a brand new piece of gear.

name: Constellations
brief: A system unique to the People of the Stars campaign, represented by 8 Constellation cards that provide new gameplay elements for settlements raised by the Tyrant.

name: Lantern Years
brief: A unit of time measurement in the Kingdom Death world, used to measure the lifespan of creatures like the Gorm which can live for hundreds of lantern years.

name: Scarlet
brief: A survivor known as the Tyrant Slayer who battled a monster by gripping its reticulated horns as they rocketed into darkness, ultimately releasing her grip and falling toward boiling ground with weapon outstretched in vain hope.
